result.execSummary:
The defendant Roger L. Hughey Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: *Pay all costs and surcharges or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
*If all conditions of probation (with the exception of the costs and surcharges) are completed, the Court will grant expungement.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roger L. Hughey Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: If all conditions of probation (with the exception of the costs and surcharges) are completed, the Court will grant expungement.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Roger L. Hughey in court with attorney Edgar Lin for Gabriela A Leija.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for sentencing, however, both court and atty Leija are in trial and unable to proceed to sentencing. Case adjourned in branch 24.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Roger L. Hughey in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court ordered the defendant to submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 24.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed - missed office contact.

Defendant Roger L. Hughey in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests a Plea Hearing. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received and FIled, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Roger L. Hughey in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The State's file is not in court.  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Roger L. Hughey in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Defendant Roger L. Hughey in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
